body.p:
Frankfort, Ky., March 20. 1861.
To Governor Magoffin:

In obedience to a resolution of the committee of arrangements appointed at a meeting of the citizens of Franklin County on yesterday, I have the honor, and at the same time the pleasure of inviting you as Governor of Kentucky, together with the Secretary and Assistant Secretary of State -- also the Heads of Departments, as well as their assistants and clerks, to meet the citizens of Frankfort and Franklin County at the Railroad Depot at 3 o'clock this evening, for the purpose of welcoming our distinguished fellow citizen, Hon. John J. Crittenden, to his home and friends in this place.

By orders of the committee.
P. Dudley
Chairman &C
